com.client.core.soap.dao

Class BullhornDao<T extends AbstractDto>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.client.core.soap.dao.BullhornDao<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenericDao<T,java.lang.Integer>

    public class BullhornDao<T extends AbstractDto>
extends java.lang.Object
implements GenericDao<T,java.lang.Integer>
    Encapsulates Bullhorn api calls in a GenericDao, this dao can then replace other GenericDaos when needed.

      • query

        public java.util.List<T> query(java.lang.String whereClause)

      • query

        public java.util.List<T> query(java.lang.String queryString,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> queryParameters)
        Description copied from interface: GenericDao
        Query using the passed in query, with named parameters contained in the queryParameters. If no queryParams needed pass in null for queryParams and have no named parameters in the query.

        Example: queryString = "SELECT * FROM Person p WHERE p.name = :name"; queryParam = Map containing "name":"Mr Toad"

        Do not concatenate the queryString with parameters before passing it in to this method! We should be using named parameters via the queryParamters to avoid SQL-injection attacks.

        Specified by:
        query in interface GenericDao<T extends AbstractDto,java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
        queryString - The query to execute, with named parameters if needed
        queryParameters - The parameters that will be used for the query. If null then query executes without params.
        Returns:
        a List of entities matching the passed in query

      • query

        public java.util.List<T> query(java.lang.String queryString,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> queryParameters,
                               java.lang.Integer limit)
        Description copied from interface: GenericDao
        Query using the passed in query, with named parameters contained in the queryParameters. If no queryParams needed pass in null for queryParams and have no named parameters in the query. Example: queryString = "SELECT * FROM Person p WHERE p.name = :name"; queryParam = Map containing "name":"Mr Toad"

        Do not concatenate the queryString with parameters before passing it in to this method! We should be using named parameters via the queryParamters to avoid SQL-injection attacks.

        Specified by:
        query in interface GenericDao<T extends AbstractDto,java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
        queryString - The query to execute, with named parameters if needed
        queryParameters - The parameters that will be used for the query. If null then query executes without params.
        limit - the maximum number of elements to return
        Returns:
        a List of entities matching the passed in query, with maximum size equal to the passed in limit

      • query

        public java.util.List<T> query(java.lang.String queryString,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> queryParameters,
                               java.lang.Integer limit,
                               java.lang.Integer start)
        Description copied from interface: GenericDao
        Query using the passed in query, with named parameters contained in the queryParameters. If no queryParams needed pass in null for queryParams and have no named parameters in the query. Example: queryString = "SELECT * FROM Person p WHERE p.name = :name"; queryParam = Map containing "name":"Mr Toad"

        Do not concatenate the queryString with parameters before passing it in to this method! We should be using named parameters via the queryParamters to avoid SQL-injection attacks.

        Specified by:
        query in interface GenericDao<T extends AbstractDto,java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
        queryString - The query to execute, with named parameters if needed
        queryParameters - The parameters that will be used for the query. If null then query executes without params.
        limit - the index of the record which we want to be the first returned based on the sort in the queryString
        start - the maximum number of elements to return
        Returns:
        a List of entities matching the passed in query, with maximum size equal to the passed in limit. The first element will be the [start]th element in the overall result set

      • getEntityIdHelper

        public EntityIdHelper<T,java.lang.Integer> getEntityIdHelper()
        The entity id helper is used to get the id of the generic entity T. Each type will need its own implementation of the EntityIdHelper to handle how to return the id.
        Returns:
